Title:
Aspicilia rogeri sp. nov., (Megasporaceae) and other allied
vagrant Aspicilia species in North America
Keywords:
Aspicilia, manna lichens, new species, North America,
vagrant lichens
Abstract:
ABSTRACT. A short revision of the vagrant Aspicilia
species of North America is presented based on morphological, molecular
and ecological data. Vagrant Aspicilia are common lichens throughout the
steppes of the northwestern USA and southwestern parts of Canada.
Species delimitation of these lichens is difficult because of the
paucity of morphological characters and large degree of variation.
Representatives of North American and Eurasian species of Aspicilia
fruticulosa and A. hispida were studied. Nucleotide sequence data (nuITS
rDNA) from both Eurasian and American species were obtained, selected
morphological features (i.e., cortex, branching pattern, position of
pycnidia and shape of conidia) are illustrated and main distinguishing
characters are tabulated. The results conclusively reveal that the
American vagrant species, known as Aspicilia fruticulosa, is distinct
and accordingly described here as Aspicilia rogeri. sp. nov. The
phylogenetic relationships of the new taxon are presented.
